menu.name: Sweet and Sour Pork

menu.name: Tom Yum Goong
menu.description: One of Thailand’s most iconic dishes, this popular soup is a spicy, sour and aromatic tastebud extravaganza! Hailing from the central region, the unique flavors of this piquant clear soup derives from the marriage of fragrant lemongrass, shallots, fish sauce, galangal, mushrooms, kaffir lime leaves, lime juice

menu.name: Khao Soi
menu.description: Noodle soups are a popular street food dish, served any time of day or night across Thailand. One of the best loved varieties is Khao Soi (or Soy), a signature Northern Thailand dish, especially revered in Chiang Mai.

menu.name: Som Tam
menu.description: Arguably Thailand’s best-known salad dishes, Som Tam is thought to have originated in Laos, but now stands as a yummy north-eastern specialty and amongst Thailand’s most beloved dishes. Not your typical salad, Som Tam comes in various guises.

menu.name: Huevos Rancheros
menu.description: It´s made with two fried corn tortillas, topped with fried beans, and two sunny side up eggs all bathed in red hot sauce and decorated with coriander and freshly ground black pepper

menu.name: Machaca
menu.description: Machaca is very versatile; you can either eat it in a taco, a stuffed burrito, flautas, or just as a stew with some tortillas, beans, or rice on the side.

menu.name: Burritos
menu.description: This is very popular on the northern side of México, especially the states bordering the United States. A burrito is a cylindrically rolled flour tortilla stuffed with different ingredients of choice, often a stew.
